intro: Hieracium pallidum subsp. floccozum, commonly known as the pale hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving the plant a fuzzy appearance. It is also noted for its ability to spread via rhizomes, making it a common weed in agricultural and natural settings.
